title: Revolution Part 6 - Education & Rites of Passage
author: marsresident / Van Kush Family
overview: Analysis of why education is essential for successful revolution, how rites of passage shape societies, and how Texas serves as a model of revolutionary education

fred_hampton_on_education.core_thesis: You can have a Revolution without education, but you do NOT want one

quiz_questions.q: According to Fred Hampton, why did Jomo Kenyatta and Papa Doc become oppressors?
quiz_questions.a: No education - they didn't understand the true enemy was oppression, not race
quiz_questions.explanation: Without education, revolutionaries become what they fought against

quiz_questions.q: What is unique about Texas 6th grade curriculum?
quiz_questions.a: Students learn about the Texas Revolution of 1836 - recent, local, relatable
quiz_questions.explanation: Not 1776 powdered wigs across the ocean, but 1836 against Mexico across the river

quiz_questions.q: What fundamental questions do Rites of Passage answer?
quiz_questions.a: What makes you an adult, where does your value come from, what is your purpose
quiz_questions.explanation: Rites of Passage shape identity and acceptable roles in society

quiz_questions.q: What was the 'Come and Take It' flag about?
quiz_questions.a: Mexico wanted the cannon back that was given to settlers for protection
quiz_questions.explanation: Texas settlers refused - led to Texas Revolution

quiz_questions.q: Why does @marsresident say Revolution must have holidays?
quiz_questions.a: Revolution must have its own Culture and Politics that are taught and given to people
quiz_questions.explanation: Massacre Day type holidays can help spark a Revolution
